headline: Meta’s US$10b AI Bet Tests Valuation And Growth Expectations
summary: Meta Platforms is planning a $10b data center in Indiana to support its expanding artificial intelligence infrastructure, targeting operations in the coming years. The company is reportedly shifting its AI approach away from open-source models toward more closed-source systems. These moves are intended to support future AI products and services across Meta's platforms, with potential implications for users, partners, and regulators. Meta Platforms (NasdaqGS:META), trading at around $639.77,...

headline: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

content.title: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
content.summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
summary:
STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.

A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.

The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.

DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.

The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.

Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.

But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.

Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.

It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.

It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.

Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.

Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.

It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.

it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.

Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.

And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.

It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.

The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.

The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

content.title: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
content.summary:
STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.

A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.

The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.

DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.

The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.

Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.

But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.

Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.

It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.

It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.

Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.

Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.

It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.

it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.

Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.

And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.

It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.

The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.

The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

headline: BofA Survey Shows Investor Worry Over Capex Race at Record High
summary: While investors participating in the survey are the most bullish they’ve been since June 2021, about 35% warned that corporations are overinvesting, the highest proportion seen in data going back two decades, strategist Michael Hartnett wrote in a note.  Record levels of capital expenditure are expected this year, with the four biggest US technology companies together forecasting spending of about $650 billion in 2026.  Microsoft Corp. plunged the most in almost six years on concerns about how long it might take for investments to pay off, while Meta Platforms Inc. jumped more than 11% after it revealed its ambitious AI spending plans.

content.title: BofA Survey Shows Investor Worry Over Capex Race at Record High
content.summary: While investors participating in the survey are the most bullish they’ve been since June 2021, about 35% warned that corporations are overinvesting, the highest proportion seen in data going back two decades, strategist Michael Hartnett wrote in a note.  Record levels of capital expenditure are expected this year, with the four biggest US technology companies together forecasting spending of about $650 billion in 2026.  Microsoft Corp. plunged the most in almost six years on concerns about how long it might take for investments to pay off, while Meta Platforms Inc. jumped more than 11% after it revealed its ambitious AI spending plans.

headline: Analysis-Europe squares up to Big Tech, risking ire of Washington
summary: MADRID, Feb 17 (Reuters) - European nations are ratcheting up the pressure on social media companies, responding to a public outcry over child safety fears but risking a backlash from the United States, home ‌to the likes of Facebook and Elon Musk's X. Spain on Tuesday ordered prosecutors to investigate Facebook owner Meta, X and TikTok for ‌allegedly spreading AI-generated child sexual images, after a similar move in Britain.

Spain on Tuesday ordered prosecutors to investigate Facebook owner Meta, X and TikTok for ‌allegedly spreading AI-generated child sexual images, after a similar move in Britain.

headline: JPMorgan Flags 'AI-Resilient' Software Names After Selloff
summary: Fears that artificial intelligence (AI) will rapidly disrupt software companies have been overdone, according to JPMorgan. The bank’s strategists believe parts of the sector are more resilient than believed, creating a potential opportunity for investors. “Given the positioning flush, overly bearish outlook on AI disruption of software and solid fundamentals, we believe the balance of risks is increasingly skewed towards a rebound,” said Dubravko Lakos‑Bujas, Head of Global Markets Strategy. In

headline: Apple Ramps Up Work on Glasses, Pendant, and Camera AirPods for AI Era
summary: The company is ramping up work on smart glasses, a pendant that can be pinned to a shirt or worn as a necklace, and AirPods with expanded AI capabilities, according to people with knowledge of the plans.  Each of the products, which will be linked to Apple’s iPhone, depends on a camera system with varying capabilities, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the plans haven’t been announced.  A spokesperson for Cupertino, California-based Apple declined to comment.

content.title: Apple Ramps Up Work on Glasses, Pendant, and Camera AirPods for AI Era

A spokesperson for Cupertino, California-based Apple declined to comment.

headline: Meta Faces the Music in Twin Trials Scrutinizing Social Media’s Effects on Kids
summary: Mark Zuckerberg is expected to take the stand tomorrow in a case born of concerns that social media use harms teens’ mental health.

headline: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We Approach with Caution
summary: A company that generates cash isn’t automatically a winner. Some businesses stockpile cash but fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their ability to expand.

content.title: 3 Cash-Producing Stocks We Approach with Caution
content.summary: A company that generates cash isn’t automatically a winner. Some businesses stockpile cash but fail to reinvest wisely, limiting their ability to expand.

headline: Nvidia and Meta expand GPU team up with millions of additional AI chips
summary: Nvidia and Meta are expanding their chip deal to include millions of more AI processors.

content.title: Nvidia and Meta expand GPU team up with millions of additional AI chips
content.summary: Nvidia and Meta are expanding their chip deal to include millions of more AI processors.

headline: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

content.title: Nvidia to sell Meta millions of chips in multiyear deal
content.summary: Nvidia on Tuesday said it has signed a multiyear deal to sell Meta Platforms millions of its current ‌and future artificial intelligence chips, including central processing units that compete ‌with products from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.  Nvidia did not disclose a value for the deal, ​but said it includes its current Blackwell chips as well as its forthcoming Rubin AI chips.  It also includes standalone installations of its Grace and Vera central processors.

headline: Meta Builds AI Infrastructure With NVIDIA
summary: Meta’s AI Roadmap Supported by Large-Scale Deployment of NVIDIA CPUs, Networking and Millions of NVIDIA Blackwell and Rubin GPUs Meta and NVIDIA NVIDIA today announced a multiyear, multigenerational strategic partnership with Meta spanning on-premises, cloud and AI infrastructure.
